content: A small suggestion for clarifying {x | p^2 âˆ£ x} in "Mathematics in Lean" near the end of section 4.1: explicitly point out that the second | is "divides". Given that we hadn't used divides in a long time, I stared at that for quite I while, trying to figure out the meaning of "the set of all x such that p^2 such that x" could possibly mean. :) I figured it was some set notation that I simply hadn't seen before.
